item.title: Myanmar leader heads to Bangkok as quake deaths climb to 3,000
item.description: Min Aung Hlaing is scheduled to attend a summit of the seven countries that border the Bay of Bengal.

item.title: Deaths of British couple in France treated as murder-suicide
item.description: The bodies of Andrew and Dawn Searle, who previously lived in East Lothian, were found at their home near Toulouse.

item.title: UK set to host 2035 Women's World Cup as only 'valid' bid
item.description: The UK is set to host the 2035 Women's World Cup as the sole "valid" bidder for the tournament, Fifa president Gianni Infantino says.

item.title: Court gives Drake access to Kendrick's contracts
item.description: The star requested access to the sensitive documents in his defamation lawsuit over Not Like Us.

item.title: World leaders criticise Trump tariffs as 'major blow'
item.description: EU chief Ursula von der Leyen says US tariffs will see "uncertainty spiral" as world leaders react to Trump's announcement.
